metadata.title: CVE-2014-7300 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low
metadata.description: GNOME Shell 3.14.x before 3.14.1, when the Screen Lock feature is used,does not limit the aggregate memory consumption of all active PrtScrequests, which allows physically proximate attackers to execute arbitrarycommands on an unattended workstation by making many PrtSc requests andleveraging a temporary lock outage, and the resulting temporary shellavailability, caused by the Linux kernel OOM killer.

criterions.comment: gnome-shell: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
